com.poesys.db.dao.delete
Interface IDeleteBatch<T extends IDbDto>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of IDbDto to delete
All Known Implementing Classes:
DeleteBatchByKey, DeleteCacheBatchByKey, DeleteMemcachedBatchByKey
public interface IDeleteBatch<T extends IDbDto>

An interface for a Command pattern class that deletes a batch of objects in the database. The implementation identifies the objects to delete based on the primary key contained in the data transfer object (DTO). The DTO must have status DELETED.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Method Summary
 void close()
          Close any resources allocated by the Command.
 void delete(java.sql.Connection connection, java.util.Collection<T> dtos, int size)
          Delete the contents of a collection of objects in the database.
 

Method Detail

delete

void delete(java.sql.Connection connection,
            java.util.Collection<T> dtos,
            int size)
            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                   BatchException
Delete the contents of a collection of objects in the database. The DTOs must contain values for the primary key.

Parameters:
connection - the database connection with which to delete the data
dtos - the data transfer objects containing the primary keys to delete
size - the size of the batches
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException - when there is a SQL error with an update
BatchException - when there is some kind of batch processing error

close

void close()
Close any resources allocated by the Command.
